newsitem.title: USA: Lomak to buy $400 million of oil assets from Cometra.
newsitem.headline: Lomak to buy $400 million of oil assets from Cometra.

text.p: Lomak Petroleum Inc. said Thursday it has agreed to buy oil and natural gas properties from units of American Cometra Inc. for $370 million in cash and $30 million in common stock.
The properties include 515 producing wells, 401 proven development projects, exploration rights on about 149,000 gross acres and 265 miles of gas pipelines, the company said.
An independent estimate determined the properties contain about 14.3 million barrels of oil and natural gas liquids, Lomak added.
The properties are located onshore in Texas and offshore in the Gulf of Mexico. Lomak said it expected to close the transaction in February, subject to due diligence and regulatory approval.
The acquisition will more than double Lomak's assets to about $650 million, the company said. It said the acquisition would boost earnings and cash flow in 1997.
Lomak is engaged in the acquisition, production, development and exploration of oil and gas in the Mid-Continent and Appalachia regions.
Lomak's stock rose $2.25 to $19.25 on the New York Stock Exchange at mid-afternoon.
